III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A went AWOL from a secure facility.
Investigation On 10/18/24 Chief Administrator self-reported to DCWL that
Youth A eloped from the program. Youth A was gone
approximately 12-15 minutes. Youth A was returned to the facility
by law enforcement.
Interviews:
Chief Administrator was contacted by phone on 10/23/24 and
reported all involved staff would be at the facility and available for
interview on 10/24/24. An on-site visit was completed on 10/24/24.
Chief Administrator provided additional information regarding
Youth A. It was reported that Youth A did not AWOL from the
secure facility. Youth A went AWOL when exiting the agency
vehicle upon returning from the gym at Havenwyck Hospital
across the street. Youth A bragged about being able to run from
staff. When he was returned to the agency he was placed on
precautions, meaning he is not allowed out of the building at this
time, he is not allowed in the fenced courtyard, he is not wearing
regular shoes, and if he is seen lingering near a door he will be
redirected.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 10/24/24.
Staff 1 reported they drove the agency vehicle when the incident
occurred. Staff 1 picked up Staff 3, Youth A, and a few other
youths from the gym across the street at the hospital campus.
Staff 1 drove everyone back across the street to the facility, where
staff exited the vehicle and stood at the door while youth exited.
Without saying anything, Youth A exited the vehicle and ran from
2

staff. Staff 3 ran after Youth A, while Staff 1 called a supervisor for
assistance.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 10/24/24.
Staff 2 is a supervisor. Staff 2 reported receiving a call for
assistance due to Youth A running from the agency vehicle. Staff
2 arrived outside and spoke with Staff 3 briefly to obtain
information about the direction Youth A was headed. Staff 2 went
to look for Youth A and was able to see him crossing a road. As
Staff 2 got closer, Youth A hid in or behind a building and staff
momentarily lost sight of him. When Youth A appeared again, he
saw Staff 2 and ran toward the highway, I-75. Staff 2 was
concerned as it was rush-hour, and the highway was very busy.
However, Youth A jumped a fence and ran across the highway.
Law Enforcement arrived and gathered information from Staff 2.
At that time, additional staff arrived in another vehicle and picked
up Staff 2. They drove across the bridge over the highway and
spotted Youth A walking up the exit ramp. Law Enforcement
arrived and approached Youth A from the bottom of the ramp.
Youth A picked up a rock to throw at the officer, but the officer
warned that he would be tased if he did not comply. Youth A
cooperated and was returned to the facility by law enforcement.
The entire incident lasted approximately fifteen minutes.
Upon arrival at the facility, staff found rocks, metal pieces, and
bottles in Youth A’s pockets. Staff 2 spoke with Youth A and
determined that he ran because he was upset with himself for
something that happened earlier in the day. Youth A was not
following directions and was redirected by a staff that he liked.
Youth A was upset about this and decided to run. Staff 2
explained that no one was upset about him being redirected. Staff
2 reinforced with Youth A how dangerous it was to run, and how
staff were scared for his safety because they care about him.
Youth A bragged about running and stated that he purposely sat
in the back of the van, so he could run after everyone got out.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 10/24/24.
Youth A reported some of his peers were being negative and he
let it get in his head. Youth A stated he was feeling unwelcome
and decided to run. Youth A indicated he did not have a plan,
other than to run. When Youth A exited the vehicle, he took off,
because he thought he could outrun staff. Youth A then crossed
the highway, where police intercepted him. Officers threatened to
tase him. Youth A stated he had been tased before and did not
want that to happen again, so he complied with police and
returned to the facility.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed by phone on 10/25/24. Staff 3 reported
she was with Youth A and peers at the gym on 10/21/24. When it
was time to leave, Youth A was hesitant but agreed. Staff 1 was
driving the van that transported the group across the street to the
gym. They arrived back at the facility and Youth A was the last
one out of the van. Youth A pushed past peers and took off
running. Staff called for assistance, and someone came outside to
take the other youth inside, while Staff 3 ran after Youth A. Staff 2
then came out of the building and took over to look for Youth A.
Staff 3 returned to the group of kids inside. Youth A was returned
to the facility by law enforcement a few minutes later. Staff 3
stated that Youth A never tried to run from the facility before and
did not say anything prior to running.
Documents reviewed
• Incident report written by Staff 1, dated 10/18/24: Youth A
went AWOL while exiting the vehicle after transport from
the hospital gym to facility. Youth A was AWOL
approximately 15 minutes.
• The foster care record for Youth A was reviewed. Previous
placements reported Youth A attempted to AWOL. Which is
part of the reason he was placed at this secure facility in
August 2024.
• The agency follows the Havenwyck Hospital policy
regarding transportation. The policy requires one driver and
one staff for ever six youth in the vehicle.
Analysis No violation was found as it was determined the agency followed
their policies regarding supervision and transportation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
